alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 02 at 7:06PM PST until December 03 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 6 inches for the Cascade crest. * WHERE...Stehekin, Holden Village, and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may become very light tonight, but will pick up again Sunday after 4 am. Snow will begin to transition to rain in the afternoon. A brief period of freezing rain is possible before changing over to rain. Ice accumulation would be just a glaze.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
